message: Did anyone saw some slides or articles about best practice in data modeling with mongoDB for own application ?
Yeah, already found it. But what i dont understand. If document size is limited, why embedding comments counts as a good approach ?
Four megs of data makes for a fairly large document.  Storing a few integers is not going to be much of an issue in terms of space.
The goal of storing a comment count or username is to prevent additional finds.
Mongo is still young so we haven't really figured out all the best practices yet.

As i understood, they store whole comment body embedded too. But i like the idea. It would be cool, to mix - first store comments embedded, but if comment block goes to grow near the limit - move it out as DBRef, or mark to look in other collection.
Just as a reference the complete works of Shakespeare sits at around 5mb http://www.gutenberg.org/ebooks/100
Well they don't natively support such a feature, but you can certainly implement something like that if you'd like.

Hitting that limit takes a good amount of work.  It's certainly possible, but it's not something that I really worry about for most applications.  Personally I would feel warm and fuzzy if there was no limit to document size, but I know that I'd abuse that at some point.
